folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY
text:
South Street, west from Market Slip, showing the lower Manhattan Skyline, and a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge. The block of houses from Market to Catherine Slips occupied by the Lawrence Son and Gerrish, bonded warehouse, (seen in the extreme right foreground), have been demolished and its site is now (1937) occupied by the New York American (a Hearst publication) Building.

1923.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip

folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY
text:
South Street, west from (No. 225), a point slightly east of Market Slip, showing a general view of the immediate area and the "skyscrapers" of the lower Manhattan financial district, as seen from the Manhattan Bridge. The most prominent buildings shown (left to right) are; The Farmer's Loan and Trust Co.; the Wall Street Tower, the Bank of Manhattan Co.; the Singer (with dame); the Woolworth and the Municipal Buildings. Also shown is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge and piers extending on the East River. Appearing in the foreground is the Hearst Publications Building (white), occupying the north side of South Street, between Market and Catherine Slips. This set of three views, more or less similar, were taken at the same time.

June 8, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip

title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip

folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
South Street, north side, east from Market, to, but not including Pike Slips. Also shown is Market Slip, east side, north from South to Water Streets. Bridge shown, is the Manhattan.
October 14, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, showing a more extensive view, but excluding Market Slip.
March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: South Street & Market Slip, Manhattan, NY
text:
232,233 and (the 1-story stable) 234-235 South Street, north side, between Market and Pike Slips (viewed eastward), showing the type of Marine merchandise sold there.

March 19, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip

folder: South Street & Market Slip (West)., Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
South Street, north side, west from Market Slip, showing (foreground) the Hearst Publications Building extending to Catherine Slip. Also shown (background), is a portion of the Brooklyn Bridge, and (left to right), the Farmer's Loan and Trust Co., the 60 Wall Street Tower and the Bank of Manhattan Co. Buildings.

March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, another view.

March 22, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
title: Manhattan: South Street - Market Slip (West).
